title: USSR / Russia
description: The history of Soviet and Russian space exploration from Sputnik to the modern Roscosmos era.

title: USA
description: The history of United States space exploration led by NASA and private partners.

title: Europe
description: European space efforts coordinated primarily through the European Space Agency (ESA).

title: China
description: The development of the Chinese space program from the first satellite to the Tiangong station.

title: Others
description: Space exploration efforts by other nations including India (ISRO) and Japan (JAXA).

title: Sputnik 1
description: The first artificial Earth satellite launched by the USSR. It orbited for three weeks before its batteries died.

title: Sputnik 2 (Laika)
description: The first spacecraft to carry a living animal (the dog Laika) into orbit.

title: Vostok 1
description: Yuri Gagarin becomes the first human in space and the first to orbit the Earth.

title: Vostok 6
description: Valentina Tereshkova becomes the first woman in space.

title: Voskhod 1
description: The first spaceflight to carry more than one crewman into orbit.

title: Voskhod 2
description: Alexei Leonov performs the first extravehicular activity (spacewalk) in history.

title: Soyuz 1
description: The first crewed flight of the Soyuz vehicle. Ended in tragedy with the death of Vladimir Komarov.

title: Salyut 1 Launch
description: The world's first space station launched by the Soviet Union.

title: Soyuz 11 / Salyut 1
description: The first and only crew to board Salyut 1. The crew died during reentry due to cabin depressurization.

title: Apollo-Soyuz Test Project
description: The first joint US-Soviet space flight. A symbol of detente during the Cold War.

title: Mir Space Station
description: The first modular space station. It held the record for the longest continuous human presence in space.

title: Buran Flight
description: The first and only orbital flight of the Soviet space shuttle.

title: Zarya Module (ISS)
description: The first module of the International Space Station launched by Russia.

title: Explorer 1
description: The first satellite launched by the United States. Discovered the Van Allen radiation belts.

title: Project Mercury
description: The first human spaceflight program of the United States.

title: Freedom 7
description: Alan Shepard becomes the first American in space during a sub-orbital flight.

title: Friendship 7
description: John Glenn becomes the first American to orbit the Earth.

title: Project Gemini
description: NASA's second human spaceflight program focusing on docking and long-duration flights.

title: Gemini 4
description: Ed White performs the first American spacewalk.

title: Gemini 8
description: First docking of two spacecraft in orbit (Armstrong and Scott).

title: Project Apollo
description: The US program to land humans on the Moon and return them safely to Earth.

title: Apollo 8
description: The first crewed spacecraft to leave Earth orbit and orbit the Moon.

title: Apollo 11
description: The first crewed lunar landing. Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin walk on the Moon.

title: Apollo 13
description: A "successful failure" where the crew returned safely after an oxygen tank explosion.

title: Apollo 17
description: The final crewed mission to the Moon.

title: Skylab Program
description: The first United States space station.

title: Space Shuttle Program
description: Reusable spacecraft system for Earth orbital missions.

title: STS-1 (Columbia)
description: The first orbital flight of the Space Shuttle.

title: STS-51-L (Challenger)
description: The Challenger disaster resulted in the loss of all seven crew members.

title: Hubble Space Telescope
description: Deployment of the premier optical space observatory.

title: Mars Pathfinder
description: The first successful rover (Sojourner) on Mars.

title: STS-107 (Columbia)
description: The loss of Space Shuttle Columbia during reentry.

title: Juno Mission
description: A mission to study Jupiter's composition and gravity field.

title: Curiosity Rover
description: A large rover exploring Gale Crater on Mars.

title: James Webb Space Telescope
description: Successor to Hubble

title: ESA Formation
description: The establishment of the European Space Agency.

title: Ariane 1 Launch
description: The first successful launch of the Ariane rocket series.

title: Giotto (Halley's Comet)
description: ESA mission that obtained the first close-up images of a comet nucleus.

title: Mars Express
description: Europe's first mission to another planet.

title: Rosetta Mission
description: First spacecraft to orbit a comet and land a probe (Philae).

title: ExoMars
description: A joint project between ESA and Roscosmos to search for life on Mars.

title: Dong Fang Hong I
description: China's first satellite launch.

title: Shenzhou 5
description: China's first crewed spaceflight

title: Chang'e 1
description: China's first lunar orbiter mission.

title: Chang'e 3
description: The first soft landing on the Moon since 1976.

title: Chang'e 4
description: The first landing on the far side of the Moon.

title: Tianhe Core Module
description: The launch of the first module of the Tiangong Space Station.

title: Zhurong Rover
description: China's first rover to land on Mars as part of Tianwen-1.

title: First Indian Rocket
description: The launch of a Nike-Apache sounding rocket from Thumba.

title: Aryabhata Satellite
description: India's first satellite

title: Osumi
description: Japan's first satellite launch.

title: Chandrayaan-1
description: India's first lunar probe.

title: Mars Orbiter Mission (Mangalyaan)
description: India's first interplanetary mission to Mars.

title: IKAROS
description: Japan's first successful demonstration of solar sail technology.

title: Chandrayaan-3
description: India becomes the first to land near the lunar south pole.

title: TIROS-1
description: The first successful weather satellite (USA).

title: Telstar 1
description: The first active communications satellite (USA).

title: Landsat Program
description: Continuous global record of Earth's land surface.

title: Voyager 2
description: Space probe launched to study the outer planets and interstellar space.

title: Voyager 1
description: The farthest human-made object from Earth.

title: Ulysses
description: Joint ESA-NASA mission to study the Sun's poles.

title: SOHO
description: Solar and Heliospheric Observatory monitoring the Sun.

title: Philae Landing
description: The first landing on a comet (67P).

title: Luna 9
description: The first spacecraft to achieve a soft landing on the Moon (USSR).

title: Luna 16
description: The first robotic sample return from the Moon.

title: Lunokhod 1
description: The first remote-controlled robot to land on another world.

title: Mars 2
description: First human-made object to reach the surface of Mars (Crash).

title: Mars 3
description: First soft landing on Mars (USSR)

title: Vega 1
description: Mission to Venus and Halley's Comet.

title: Expedition 1
description: The first long-term residents arrive at the ISS.

title: New Horizons Pluto Flyby
description: The first close-up images of Pluto.

title: Crew Dragon Demo-2
description: The first crewed orbital flight from US soil since 2011 (SpaceX).

title: Artemis I
description: Uncrewed test flight of the SLS and Orion toward the Moon.

title: SLIM Landing
description: Japan becomes the fifth nation to soft-land on the Moon.
